caption: I have been coming here for four years now and haven't been disappointed a single time.

We sat outside,  it was great!! Great atmosphere with Boise downtown lights. Food was excellent and our waitress was fantastic.  Best service I have had in a very long time. My glass was never empty.  I wish I caught her name. So shout out to the little blonde who waited on the outside tables this evening.  You rock!!
It was really a treat to dine with the folks at Alavita tonight. Arugula salad was fresh and the cherries were tasty. Risotto was creamy and sweet and the braised ribs were perfect.

I've wanted to try Alavita for some time as we love Fork (their other restaurant).  I'm Italian and we made our own pasta as a child so trying a restaurants homemade pasta is a must for me.  The ambiance is awesome!  I love the old town feel with the brick walls and cozy booths.  Now the food...the meat and cheese apps were fantastic...especially the prosciutto and parmesan balsamic cheese.  And the bread served with the meat and cheese were off the charts!  The artichoke hearts were prepared perfectly as well!  I would have been happy staying in app land but had to try the pasta too of course.  I opted for the Rigatoni and it was fabulous.  The pasta was excellent and the fresh mushrooms and short ribs in it were spot on.  My coworker had the risotto special and that dish was full of flavor and richness as it should.  All that to say, the food was excellent and we didn't leave feeling "restaurant bloated"  And I must give props to our server Shaina.  Even if the meal was just okay (which it wasn't, it was great!), she definitely made the evening even better!  She was so friendly and knowledgeable and was a pleasure to have taking care of us!!  She came around the right amount of time.  She gave us time to visit yet made sure we were taken care of.  She embodies the "perfect" server at a restaurant like this and I'm glad we had her taking care of us.  All in all, a fantastic experience and I highly recommend this place!  We'll be back for sure!!
Wonderful restaurant for going out for a date or a girlfriend outing. The chef's four choice of appetizer was amazing.
Our favorite place in Boise. Delicious food and great service.

My husband and I went to Alavita last night for our first date in 8 months (we had our second baby last July and haven't gotten out much since). Our appetizers were absolutely delicious. The pasta was slightly undercooked for me, but that might have been personal preference and the flavors were spectacular. The reason I am giving 3 stars is due to the service we received. We made reservations over a month in advance and were seated about a foot away from the door. There was a curtain to stop some of the breeze, but the 27° breeze was hitting our legs and feet every time someone left. After we finished our appetizers, I asked if we could be placed elsewhere because it was taking away from the experience. The hostess eventually came over and said, " We can put you at that booth over there but it's a small venue so you will probably feel it over there too." She was incredibly condescending and sounded like something my mother would've said to me as a child. She made us feel inconsiderate when, logically, the cold is not going to be as intense if we're sitting 30 feet from the door versus 2. The food was great, but the attitude of the service was deplorable.
Small space, limited seating, unlimited flavor. We were a bit flustered that we had to wait longer than our reservation time, but it ended up being the best pasta I've had in a very long time.

A must go if you have not been to this restaurant! The food is amazing. I had pasta with spicy sausage and it was probably the best pasta I had in awhile. The pasta is made fresh and you can tell. The staff was great to. Go ASAP. You will not be disappointed.
Incredible food and great vibe

Local restaurant serving Italian inspired dishes.  Upscale decor.  Fresh sauces and pasta are used in preparation of each meal.  Full bar and wine list compliment each course.  Plenty of on street parking.
You ever get SO excited for your meal you forget to take a picture/breathe/ponder your existence? That happens here. 11/10 would eat here again. Every week if I could afford it.
Great environment and a solid experience from the wait staff to the food, dessert and drinks. Excellent night out for sure!

The flavor profiles and textures for all of the food was balanced, full, and complex. But the best part was the cannoli....on my is it yum. The deep caramel flavor of the florentine cookie combined with the light and slightly sweet marscapone filling was the perfect summer treat...or any time of the year treat.

Staff was awesome, food was better!  Absolutely delicious.  Chefs sampler appetizer with the parmesan gilato was legit.  Got the Ceasar salad.  Was not expecting it to be that good, but it was. Main course was Risotto and the black ravioli.  No complaints at all.  We even made room for dessert.  The vanilla budino thing was awesome.  Definitely coming back soon.

I believe this is owned and/or managed by the same people that own Fork. Also good food, cozy environment, very attentive service. Didn't take long to get our food after ordering either. Well done guys!
Nice place. Veteran and Postmates friendly.

The food is here wonderful and the service is amazing. The ladies that work here are incredibly friendly and welcoming. The only reason that it's not five stars is the smaller menu. However, what they do serve is great. Thank you for the wonderful family dinner.

VERY open kitchen. Huge cool square bar with patron seats all the way around. Cool booths like look like they are from a haunted house. Sister restaurant of the always amazing Fork, but totally different menu and vibe. Everything we ordered was great, as were the cocktails and the service was perfect.
Go to spot for a celebration meal. Lobster squid ink ravioli is very yummy
Very nice and good. Thank you.
Never disappoints. Great service, great food and drinks and beautiful restaurants
All of the staff were lovely and perfessional! Our server Miss Lucy was wonderful. My partner and I will be back asking for her with how utterly sweet and friendly she was, we had a lovely evening!
Good food.. Clean...

Following the advice of our friends, we had the meatball appetizer, which was fine, but not as flavorful as I thought it might be. Then my fiance and I shared two pasta dishes - one with mild sausage and tomatoes and a red-ish sauce, and the other one with a lighter, oil-based sauce with veggies.
First time dining at Alavita. Great service; delicious food. Appreciate all the GF options. We will be back.
Great food, great service.
Our waitress, Lucy, was fantastic! The only thing better than our service was our food!
Great food and even better cocktails! Very professional service and beautiful ambiance. The black ravioli is delightful.
Amazing food! The Parpardelle was incredible... Emphasis on "edible"! All of the staff was very helpful and offered great menu options. 10 out of 10 would order grilled artichoke hearts again.

Fine dinning at its best. The food was oh so good! Halibut was cooked perfectly. Black ravioli was just awesome. The cocktails were well worth trying. The staff were very attentive and just plain friendly. We will definitely be returning here.

Legit one of the best meals I've ever had. Easily a top 3 in Boise! Such a kind and friendly environment  with incredible service. We had Shaina as our waitress and literally everything she said helpful and also correct. If you can't decide where to go and feel like a nice treat : THIS IS THE PLACE!
Wow, amazing food and service. Will come back... tomorrow
Not too many options as far as food, but a wide pallet for drinks. Not too pricey either.

Felt so great (and safe) to go out and support local quizine! We started with the round midnight & basil foam cocktails and Baratta antipasti and could have just stopped right there! So good! We had help choosing a bottle of wine to pair with the absolutely incredible short ribs and fresh made pasta dish! I can’t even tell you how fantastic all this food was!! We finished by sharing some yummy Pistachio Cannoli, like we actually had any room. Lol. Great atmosphere and great food!!!
Great food, atmosphere!
Delicious
Really good. The artichoke appetizer was excellent and the Caesar was unique and very good. Pastas were fresh and made well.
Super nice appetizers, fresh pasta and ravioli, interesting cocktails. Bring someone's wallet.
Person favorite! Great food! Menu always changes.  The chefs choice boards are a must try.
Food was not as good as it had been that last few times I had eaten there. Service was slower than usual, but the waitress was very good. The meatballs were very good.
Fantastic, cozy atmosphere and delicious food.

They discriminate!! I was waiting on my table with my group when I overheard the desk tell a woman she could not enter although she had reservations. She didn’t have on a mask and they refused her service. She clearly stated she had a medical exemption and the lady said “I don’t care”. I was appalled! I cannot believe a restaurant would refuse service to a woman and her family because of a disability. That is complete discrimination. Our party left in support of hers being turned away. CLEARLY mask mandates say if you have a medical condition you are exempt. It’s a restaurant where you just take it off at the table anyway. Terrible. So sad.
Good service and food was delicious
Fantastic

It was ok.  A little overpriced, but you pay for local and fresh.  My ink squid pasta was amazing (with some heat).  The Wagyu beef  was ok, I have had much better, but it was cooked ok, just not the flavor and texture we've had elsewhere...other pasta dishes were ok (fresh) and the meatballs were ok (not great).
Amazing food, and atmosphere. Definitely worth checking out.
Always an incredible experience. The black ravioli is otherworldly.

The Tagliatelle was a pure experience. The Chicken Sugo was creamy and had an depth of flavor that you can only achieve with long roasted the chicken and a delicious tomato sauce. It was topped with more Burrata and a drizzle of olive oil. FOod was amazing.
Always AMAZING!!
WOW! Amazing carry out! Excellent service and flavorful delicious food always make our dining experience wonderful! Thank you!
Really enjoyable dining experience.  If you're looking for a date night in the heart of Boise I would highly recommend.  An interesting menu with some unexpected twists.
Delicious!

This place is literally the best place in Boise. The combinations of flavors and quality of food amazes me Everytime. I usually get the entrees rather than the pasta here and I have been impressed each time. My significant other usually gets the pasta and he has given just as much praise. The service here is also so caring and welcoming, it makes me just want to hang out there longer. The drinks are quite delicious too. If your a foodie and love great service, defiantly go here. They show a lot of creativity, care, and quality in their food, service, and atmosphere.
Very nice cod fish with risotto following excellent charcuterie catching up with old friends. A memorable evening.

Consistently great service and food. There are plenty of gluten free options if needed. The portions are normal sized. Wonderful flavors; you want to savor these bites! The decor and ambiance are also unique and attractive. Nice that you can see the whole team of employees working together well.

The mussels were outstanding. The gluten free pasta in my seafood dish was not cooked well; however it was loaded with seafood, which made up for it. Nice atmosphere and good service. I would go back.

Very nice place, great atmosphere,  food is excellent and the waiters are very professional ... to top it all of ...the owner adds a special touch by offering a free icecream desert for our youngest family member and coloring book as well.. Thank you

My wife and I are new to Boise. We stumbled upon ÀLAVITA 2 weeks ago after searching yelp while downtown.  We walked in on a Friday night and as expected it was very busy. No tables available due to reservation but the staff was very friendly about letting us use the full service bar.  The inside of the restaurant is literally perfect. It’s small maybe 30 tables, but the atmosphere was perfect. Buzzing full of chatter. The open kitchen is a nice touch as you can see the kitchen staff at work pumping out some amazing food.  The highlight of our food-  The Burrata. The creamy burrata is served on a apricot jam that mixes perfectly with the salty burrata. Toasted bread to accompanying it.  My wife and I ordered Tagliatelle and Squid Ink Bucatini.  The Tagliatelle was a pure experience. The Chicken Sugo was creamy and had an depth of flavor that you can only achieve with long roasted the chicken and a delicious tomato sauce. It was topped with more Burrata and a drizzle of olive oil.  Squid Ink Bucatini was such a beautiful dish. You have this beautiful black pasta that is coated in a slightly spicy tomato sauce, breadcrumbs, capers, shrimp and calamari. The calamari was so soft and not like rubber bands. I can’t wait to order this again.  The desserts we shared were the Chocolate olive oil cake with peppered toasted marshmallow and the salt caramel gelato. This dish you have to us both to make marriage. The cake is soft and moist and not sweet, adding the peppered marshmallow and the sweet gelato is a perfect blend.  The Poached Pear. Where do you start? The pear perfect. It’s slightly firm sitting in a pool of zabaione, if you don’t know what is, it’s what dreams are made of. This is a perfect finish to the night.  The Staff. Knowledgeable, friendly and professional. The staff knew everything about the dishes and explained everything when we had questions.  In closing the chef and staff understand balance, flavor and restraint. We cannot wait to come back.

Extremely good pasta and the mushrooms were to die for.  We picked a random wine off the menu and it was a great pairing. The  atmosphere was beautiful, we loved the different art pieces and textures throughout the restaurant. We'll be back again for our fancy dinner nights.

Fantastic service and excellent food plus a suave, romantic ambiance. Entire staff was very friendly and attentive, clearing plates and filling water quickly, checking to make sure we didn't need anything else.  Food was outstanding, from the winter citrus & arancini appetizers to the fresh-made pasta.  Cocktails also excellent, especially the smoked cocktail that comes in an inverted glass filled with smoke from a scorched piece of wood.
Great service and always an amazing meal.

Awesome for what it was a restaurant focused on great plating good food at an affordable price nothing on this menu will blow you away with quality however it won't leave you disappointed either very nice feeling decently prepared tasty meal at a price that's still affordable for the average person
A cozy spot with delicious food. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and extremely helpful.
Squid ink bucatini. Delicious! Visit with great friends! Make a reservation or squeeze into the bar if you eat early. It's worth it!
A lovely place with an amazing atmosphere and even better food! The service was great as well. We felt exceptionally welcome there.
Wonderful place for dinner.  The food and service was amazing

This has always been one of our date night places. Customer service is always professional and efficient! The wine was lovely (glass of Cab Sauv and Sauv Blanc). The mussels were very nice. My hubby got the a nice flat noodle, meat, red sauce dish that is heavenly. I got the Black Ravioli in a cream sauce with shrimp and crab. I've always wanted to try it yet was honestly, a little underwhelmed. The flavor just seemed slightly off and did not sit well with my stomach. I've never been disappointed at Alavita and would hate to say it because I love this restaurant - yet, I was disappointed in my personal meal. Everything else was great but to leave with a disappointed dish the last taste on your tongue has me questioning if/when we go back. This breaks my heart even typing this.
Love the main dishes , a little to fancy food for my liking. But I do recommend it and especially their other restaurant the Fork.
Consistent, richly delicious Italian food. Tonight I especially enjoyed the gnocchi!
Serving staff was pleasant and attentive.  Food was delicious.  Ambience was great.

I've been going here for years and this is the only complaint I've had.  I ordered the steak special on NYE and it was really not good...not the worst steak I've ever had but by far the worst $45 steak I've ever had.  Was really disappointed.
My dishes were missing acidity but overall great experience
Great place downtown to grab a bite to eat.
This is NOT an Italian restaurant. It’s a mish mash of flavors and some of them are good. The squid ink pasta has no squid ink sauce, enough said.... Good service. Way overpriced for what it is.
Great food, somewhat pricey but appreciated the appropriately sized servings.  Sat at the bar and received good service.
My wife and I like this Boise spot for italian. Good food, drinks and service.
Our favorite restaurant in Boise
Great service at the bar!
The food was FABULOUS (lamb) and the service was exceptionally good.  Would highly recommend!
Been here a number of times.  Food is generally very good, but the drinks are average.  We always have fun here and the wait staff is always on point.
Very good Italian food in a pleasant environment.  Service was solid and the menu is quite diverse.
Smallish and nice. Good food and service.
Good food, friendly staff, nice place
The ambiance and staff were great but the food left much to be desired. The black cod was undercooked and the lasagna was somewhat bland. Will not return...
Well worth the wait. We are from out of town, and ALAVITA was recommended to us by a friend who lives in Boise. All 4 people in the party enjoyed their orders. The service was excellent too!

We had such High hopes & I think us waiting for four anniversaries to get a reservation set our bar too high! If it wasn't for our amazing waitress I would leave two stars sadly. The sister restaurant Fork serves better pasta & that shocks me! Buccatani recommended was barely warm & had almost no flavor & the cheese on top was almost frozen so it made the dish colder. And the papperdelli pasta with spicy sausage was extremely spicy but at least the sauce had flavor. Sadly the pasta was the true let down & it sucks cause homemade pasta is the best thing in the world or at least it should be...  And I was shocked at the menu as it's supposed to be seasonal but it was still set up for August more so then mid October. 95% of the pasta dishes were tomato based & part of the reason I went was for an Alfredo as I have food allergies & this & Fork are one of only three restaurants in the valley who use Cloverleaf Cream. I have watched all their videos making pasta & honestly I have had boxed pasta with more flavor & that made me sad. At least salt the water please.... Maybe it was just a bad night but I was so disappointed. And as a side note could the chef go over to Fork & be taught how to make potatoes? Fondant potatoes are not just a fancy shaped boiled potato, they are supposed to be crispy & golden brown on the outside & creamy luscious on the inside.. Best thing on the menu was our appetizers & desserts! Seriously I will dream about those artichokes! But my take away should have been about amazing pasta 😢
Great Italian food, right here in Boise!

Our dinner felt like happy hour: we sat at the bar. We had the artichoke appetizer, followed by the gnocchi and the black ravioli. Unfortunately we had to send the ravioli back since it was cold and was a totally different temperature than the gnocchi. We spent $100 and  we left looking at each other like what the heck just happened. Generally the price to product value is off. Go to Luciano’s on orchard. Please just trust us.

This spot really is about as good as it gets when you are looking for fresh, seasonal food with a fun Italian flare. This was our second trip in and I think it was about as good as the first time in minus a few hiccups with service. This was our anniversary dinner and a meal that we have been looking forward to all month.... and it did not disappoint. They even bought us a dessert to top it all off, really great dessert too! Thank you so much.
Food & service was excellent

We gathered in Boise from across the country and popped into Alavita. Our server, Nicole, made everything warm and comfortable as we explored the menu. We did the evening soup to nuts and could not have enjoyed a birthday more.

Wonderful atmosphere. Friendly and energetic wait staff. Food was well above average. Tuber pasta with my order wasn't cooked to completion as it was still a bit raw hard. Other than that, this place is magnifico!
Food is always amazing and the staff is very knowledgeable and accommodating
Best Italian food I've had since last trip to Italy.  Service as good ad the food. Thanks.

As far as Italian food goes in Boise, you'd be better off going to the Olive Garden. The portions are incredibly small for the price and the flavor is less than average. The fact that the pasta is made fresh is irrelevant when nothing else is good. I'm not sure how this place is still open or has good reviews honestly.
This was my favorite place to go special.  But last night they charged me $1.50 for ice in my Hendricks “on the rocks.” This is Boise not Manhattan.  special no more.

(Translated by Google) Wonderful food, excellent service, a comfortable place, all the dishes were perfect, the desserts amazing!  (Original) Maravillosa comida, excelente atención, un lugar cómodo, todos los platos estaban perfectos, los postres increíbles!
Small portions and the food was just ok. Location was nice.
The food here is pretty great with a reasonable price!
My experience here was great. The staff is attentive and helpful. The restaurant is cozy with a modern vibe that sources almost everything locally. I encourage you to visit Alavita.
The best wait staff and Italian food in Boise. Pasta is fresh daily with local ingredients.
Literally some of the best food ever I would drive back to idaho just for it
Great food and wine.

Great little restaurant in downtown Boise.  Had the lobster ravioli and it was delicious.   Just wish the portion size was a bit bigger.  Left me craving more.  Even just some veggies on the side or bread would have made my 4 star review a 5 star!  Otherwise, great food and great staff.  Will likely be back again!
Great birthday dinner for two on the patio!
Excellent food!!
ALAVITA was a wonderful experience.The service was exceptional,food & cocktails selections amazing.First timers & will return. 👍😊 #alavita #boisidaho #supportlocals
Delicious  food and great wine. The staff was all very pleasant.
Food and service exceded all expectations.  Tomato and peach salad were the most amazing combination of flavors.

Loved this place! Beautiful jewel tone decor, relaxing atmosphere. Our server, Casey, was great - attentive but not overly so. Appetizers of grilled artichokes and burrata with an excellent mostarda were tasty. Pappardelle with spicy sausage was cooked perfectly, ricotta gnocchi were a little heavy, but still very good. Caramel budino was so good, as were the gelatos.  Hats off to Kerry, you run a fabulous restaurant!
Alavita Black Ravioli = Healthy, Light, Delicious, and Filling.  Everything you want in food.  My hat goes off to the chef!

Beautiful restaurant, amazing bar service, creative cocktails, and the dishes were beautifully executed. They put time and care into the few dishes they have and execute them well. Our bartender was extremely friendly, knowledgeable, and efficient. This was my favorite meal during our trip to Boise.

Phenomenal!  Our family loves Italian and have hit some very good places in our travels all over the world.  This, for me definitely at the high end of the list.  And in our own backyard to boot!  I loved the the black ravioli.  It was excellent.  The fresh donut dessert finished it off with an exclamation.  Service was prompt and friendly.  Wait was short.  And atmosphere was very relaxing.  Will definitely be back.
Very good. Definitely would recommend giving them a try
If you want authentic Itallian cuisine then this is absolutely awesome food and service!

Location and outdoor patio were ideal but the food, although well plated and colorful, was a disappointment.  Menu may appeal to hipsters who enjoy basil infused cocktails and black ravioli but I would steer clear if you’re expecting familiar comfort food.  Despite feeling like a square peg in round whole the entire meal, the service was excellent.
Decent food and the service was quick for a large group. I had the Gnocchi and it was delicious.
Good atmosphere, and service. But, the serving size is very small. Bought an entree and isn’t served with a soup, salad, or bread. Prices are very high.
Alavita was excellent!  Great service, delicious food, fun atmosphere exclamation!  Highly recommended!
I won't be back because price verses quality wasn't there. It was just OK.
Excellent service and delicious food.

Me and my husband love Alavita. We went here on our first anniversary and have gone back every year since. They make all their pasta in house and I haven't had a dish that I didn't love. Cozy restaurant with a great atmosephere.
Amazing food, atomsophere and service. Great wine selection.
Great Chicken  and Angel hair pasta with clams

We were actually headed to Fork and couldn’t pass up the cozy vibe of Alavita! And it had been SO long since we had GOOD, authentic homemade Italian food. It was truly one of the best Italian meals we’ve ever had. We sat at a small 2 top in the front bar area, vibe was cozy with Frank Sinatra playing in the background. Ordered the blood orange Bellini it was different but really good. Same with bruschetta app, I think there was butternut squash (which I’m typically not a fan of) a mild citrus flavor, and I actually really enjoyed it even though it was different. Husband ordered the special, it was a risotto, the best we’ve ever had! Really, SO good! I opted for something more traditional, spaghetti & meatballs. The pasta was super fresh and we really enjoyed everything we had. I’d love to go back if we are ever visiting again.

Tonight was an amazing first experience at ALAVITA with my hubby!! The staff was very professional, informative about their menu, and super friendly!! You can taste the passion that goes into their food and the flavors just sing in your mouth!! We will definitely be coming back for sure!!

Had such high hope for this place. We got the black ravioli and Bolognese pasta. Both were undercooked and completely devoid of flavor. Extremely disappointed. However, beautiful ambiance and fast, friendly service.
Service was outstanding.  The fresh homemade pasta was just average.  Nice that it is homemade and was cook really well but lacked favor. Could have used more seasoning and or spices.

Tried eating dinner here with my husband for a date night. It was listed in the Top Date Night Spots in Boise, but we went it seemed more apt for a happy hour get together with the people attending. But the pasta is truly a reason to come back, just not for date night.

Stayed in Boise for 2 nights and had dinner here our second night. We sat at the bar and both ordered pasta dishes. Both dishes were excellent, better than what we usually get at “top” Italian restaurants on the East Coast. Prices very reasonable, service was efficient and friendly. We came on a Monday night at 6 pm and the restaurant was very busy. So either plan to sit at the bar or plan ahead and make a reservation. There is also some outside seating. Highly recommend.
Our fave.

SUPER overrated. The risotto is generally not cooked correctly, and the few times I have been, completely lacked flavor. I have been three separate times, and not once left satisfied with my food or drink for what I paid. The only thing this company has going for it is the service. It's not the best, but it's better than the consumption options.
It was good. Not a ton of gluten free options but the staff waa as friendly and the food was good.
Delicious pizza, warm place
Great food and service but dont go if you are in a hurry. Small cozy restaurant you can get a view of the chefs cooking and making the food. Small menu.
Excellent local italian restaurant. We enjoyed the black ravioli and intimate surrounding.
Outstanding food, the very best I have had.
Awesome Italian food and unique menu

In our three days in Boise we’ve had a lot of very good meals, but this place tops them all. Sensational food. Loved the salumi plate. Flavorful spinach fettuccine with halibut. My mom enjoyed the eggplant parmigiana and it was beautifully presented. Our son loved the lamb rigatoni. Complements to everyone involved. Can’t wait to come back to Boise again and will definitely return to this restaurant.

This photo was taken almost 3 years ago and when their help was a little more humble. Great food. I went in last night and the Hostess almost scoffed at us for not knowing to make a reservation on a Tuesday night, like it was the Last Supper and we were late. Very pretentious and flat out rude. We walked a block away to Asiago's and it was a blessing. I don't care how good the food is somewhere if you get so busy you can't be kind to people I don't want to give you my money. It's also very cramped, loud and uncomfortable in there. Too many tables in a small space.
This is an amazing restaurant in Boise. A must "go to" if you are in town on business or for pleasure. Loved it!

I came here a few years ago and remember thinking YUM. But tonight our portions were small and the pasta dishes were sub-par. They lacked flavor, we ended up salt and pepper-ing our dishes multiple times. At $19 per dish of pasta, I was underwhelmed.
Quite stellar as usual 😉
Service was exemplary and food was delicious. The Bucatini is the way to go.
Great food and friendly staff.
Great service, great food!

On a whim we decided to have a date night. My fiance and I are new to Boise from Seattle and this place could go head to head with any of Tom Douglas' joints. Our waiter was Casey, he was perfectly friendly and did a wonderful job offering us the perfect balance of privacy and warmth. The food was delicious, especially the black ravioli. Very reasonably priced for such a nice meal, we were able to have drinks, appetizer, two of the pricier entrees and dessert for under 100 bucks, something practically unheard of in Seattle. The ambiance is intimate and sultry, really great for a date night. Overall I was really shocked that we could get an experience even nicer than one in Seattle in much cozier Boise, yet another reason to add to my ever growing list of reasons I'm glad I moved. We will FOR SURE become repeat customers and are excited to patron Fork as well. Bravo!

If only there were more than just 5 stars, ALAVITA is worthy of 6 out of five.  The food is healthy, fresh and of exceptional quality, the catering is reasonable and abundant and the environment is pleasing.  High-Five to my friend Lisa Peterson!

The service and atmosphere were great. However, both entrees ordered were mediocre at best.  The flavors on both were bland and boring and the risotto was soupy, with the rice mushy AND under-cooked. Seemed way overpriced for the quality of the food--I would have expected my $23 English pea & asparagus (no meet or fancy mushrooms...) risotto entree to have been 10x more impressive.
Our favorite Italian restaurant in the Treasure Valley.
This is one of worst itailan food I Had !!!
Amazing food, great service, and way faster than conventional chain restaurants. 10/10 will visit again.

Absolutely the worst dining experience. It took an hour to get a three meatball appetizer that was barely warm. After another 30 minutes our meals were still not served though 8 other parties were served that arrived after us. They blamed it on a “to go” order. Then they rushed our food as we asked to cancel our order and boxed it to go...the food was not even what we ordered! Horrible experience.

The service was good. The drinks were good. The environment is very nice. You're better off if you make a reservation. They have a lot of drink options available since they have a full bar. They have good wines. From what I could tell all the staff enjoyed working at this restaurant. The staff was very knowledgeable about their menu. They have a good vegan menu and they explained it very well to the some of the people at my table. They will cook it however you want.  I recommend this restaurant.
Incredible made in house pasta. Appetizers were on point and great menu selection. Definitely going to be making regular stops when in the area!
Please bring back the bacon wrapped scallops.
For me one of the best restaurants in town.
Good food and great drinks but portions were a little small.

We went to Alavita for a birthday. The service was spectacular. From the host, to the manager, to both servers on staff - they were highly knowledgeable & efficient. We were made to feel incredibly special and highly enjoyed the experience. Casey, our server, truly  went above and beyond. The food, as always was top quality.
Great service, food and wine!
Good food.... check your water though... not clean.

We were actually headed to Fork and couldn’t pass up the cozy vibe of Alavita! And it had been SO long since we had GOOD, authentic homemade Italian food. It was truly one of the best Italian meals we’ve ever had. We sat at a small 2 top in the front bar area, vibe was cozy with Frank Sinatra playing in the background. Ordered the blood orange Bellini it was different but really good. Same with bruschetta app, I think there was butternut squash (which I’m typically not a fan of) a mild citrus flavor, and I actually really enjoyed it even though it was different. My friend ordered the special, it was a risotto, the best we’ve ever had! Really, SO good! I opted for something more traditional, spaghetti & meatballs. The pasta was super fresh and we really enjoyed everything we had. I’d love to go back if we are ever visiting again.
Excellent service and culinary experience.
A small, but wonderfully decorated venue. I had the sweet potato gnocchi, which was amazing. Next time I'm trying the famous black ravioli.

This place has an amazing atmosphere and menu. The food was delicious and the drinks complimented each dish beautifully. Most of the bar/serving staff is great, but a few sling more attitude than I appreciate. Overall I'm happy with my decision to visit and will certainly be returning!
Good Italian atmosphere and food. If your looking for GF and Vegan pastas this not the place. Website menu needs updated.
I'm from Boston MA, and I'm going to try this place.  I haven't found an authentic Italian restaurant since I have been here! Will let you know
Amazing food and kind, thoughtful service
Always good!!
the food was great and friendly staff the waiter Casey was very helpful with menu and cocktails. the manager Kerry was friendly and helpful.it was a very enjoyable experince
Great food. Great atmosphere. And great service.
Fantastic service, amazing food!

Amazing meal. We went with two of their specials which were amazing. Very knowledgeable server (Mikaela) and their wine specialist (Casey) helped us pair our meal with some phenomenal wine. Definitely recommend.
Amazing! Everything we tasted was absolutely delicious.
Great food, service, atmosphere.
Every time I eat here I love it more than the last time. I almost always get the nightly special and every time it's tasty and reminds me of my grandma's cooking
I would say this is a five-star only because I'm Italian I've never been here but I would love to go I was told that it's the greatest place for Italian food
Food is always amazing .
Tasty, friendly, a lil pricey
Their desserts are amazing!!!
Very good food, terrific service!
Absolutely delicious, great Italian food. Super laid back modern vibe too. Highly recommended.
Currently my favorite place for Itallian downtown.

As a local a Real Estate Agent, I am often asked where to eat. There is no better Italian restaurant in downtown Boise! I had the black ravioli with king crab claw and it was amazing! Breadsticks are the best!
Christian was a great service provider at the bar.  Nice desserts.  Great pour over coffee.  A great end to a nice evening!
Very good food and service.

It was okay... this place does a modern interpretation of Italian dishes with a minimalist presentation. As such, the portions were a little on the small side. A good example was the pistachio canoli we had for dessert:  it didn't have the usual canoli filling, traditional canoli shell, or any taste of pistachio. Instead of a dollop of whipped cream on the side, they smeared it around the rim of the plate for presentation.  Weird.  I think Asiago's is a better option if you want traditional Italian food.
Amazing food and service. Made an ordinary night special. Thank you!
This place.... took my German mother-in-law here. She was a school teacher who summered in Italy. She loved it. Incredible food, amazing service, and a great atmosphere.
The very best Italian in town. Classic Italian dishes with a modern flair. The cannoli is memorable. It's worth the trip to the restaurant just for that!
Delicious Boise favorite. Love watching them make pasta.

If I could leave a negative star, I would. Do not come here if you're a single woman having dinner alone. I visited at 5:00 pm, thinking dinner was a possibility without a reservation at that time. Restaurant was almost empty. Two separate women sitting at the bar. The unfriendly hostess indicated I could either sit at the bar, or the one table right next to her and five feet from the door. I have balance issues so double checked if no other table was available (it was the worst in the place). Nope and double nope. Sat down to dinner. 10 minutes later two men arrived without reservations. The manager greeted them and offered them an excellent table, or the bar. They sat at the bar. Afterwards, I asked the hostess about the better availability. She indicated there must have been a mistake as the better table was reserved. Ten minutes later a couple arrived without reservations. They were seated at the better table. Not very professional at all.
Pretty expensive but the food was really, really good! The atmosphere is unique and cozy. Doesn't feel like an "Italian restaurant" kind of more like a hipster place.
Amazing service. Good food! Meatball app and scallops are must gets.
I brought my husband here after he came back from over seas. Fighting for your country stirs up an appetite. We were not disappointed welcome home honey😘
Yum!!
Amazing Pappardelle!

My favorite restaurant...consistently stellar food,ambience and customer service...went again on Sunday..Christian was our waiter...hands down a 10!!!  Go visit and have a truly divine dining experience!
Our favorite Italian restaurant period.

This place rocked - dynamite service and delicious food. We sat at the bar, after the hostess got someone to move creating two seats next to each other. Thank you! The Bartender was one of a  kind, the best of Boise! He answered every question we had about the food, wine, local beer and Boise! Every recommendation was spot on. Not only for us but for everyone fortunate enough to be seated at the bar. Black Ravioli was scrumptious, delicious cannoli. Refreshing Chianti! Just a wonderful evening with good food and conversation. 5 Stars!

Two entrées, two salads, two drinks and no dessert, cost around $90 with tip. At that price, I am satisfied, but not amazed.  Their cocktails are not as inventive as The Modern, but they do the basics very well, and they do some interesting things with smoke. Their Rock & Rye, with horehound tea is emblematic of what they do best: a well executed standard with a slight twist.  Their food is quite good—better than most in Boise—but a tad overpriced for what it is. For example, their shortrib meat balls over linguini comes with excellent meatballs, tasty house made pasta, and a sauce that is plain boring. Their Cavatelli (house-made sausage and broccoli on house-made pasta) ranges from heavenly to bad. Four of six times it has been quite good, once it was amazing, and once it was bad.  And that brings me to the service: almost always it is friendly and efficient, but rarely it can be unpleasant. (And of course that seems to happen when the food is off.) After a bad experience, I started sitting at the bar. The barkeep is knowledgeable and friendly. And, the one time he made a mistake on an order, he had it fixed immediately.(I know it’s selfish of me, but I’ll be sad when he graduates from law school).  Salads are fresh and well executed, but nothing extraordinary.  Desserts are meh. Have a second cocktail instead.  At least once every meal, jazz/pop standard comes on it makes me smile.
Great food and service for a special celebration!
Great pasta and the bartender, Christian, was such a delight! Can't wait to come back
Great food & atmosphere.
Great spaghetti! Love this place.

Alavita is one of  our all-time favorite places to go for a special occasion. The food is absolutely phenomenal, the service is excellent (the manager is often the Hostess who greets you at the door and helps with tables), and the atmosphere is both intimate and energetic. If you have never been here, then you are missing out greatly! Please treat yourselves to the  Bruchetta or Artichokes appetizer, Eggplant Parmigiana (often sold-out because it is in high demand), and the Vanilla Budino (absolutely amazing!) and I promise you will love it! Thank me later.
Amazing food and atmosphere. Can’t wait to come back. Was disappointed they didn’t have a simple Alfredo on the menu though
Great pasta

Great food friendly service. Surprisingly busy for a Monday night, but that just shows this place is popular. I liked the atmosphere and decor, very stylish and neat. Would like to try dining outside next time I go. Try the black ravioli and artichoke hearts!
Amazing food and great service a little pricey for the amount of food you get but that's fine dining for you! 10 out of 10 would recomend

Incredible pasta. Very upscale atmosphere, I recommend getting reservations. All of their pasta is made homemade from scratch daily, which is obvious with one bite of linguini! Their cocktail selection features a few house creations, a few Itillian classics, and their bartenders can make any classic cocktail, I had a great Sazerac. For an appetizer I recommend the burrata. Very creamy cheese served with fresh jam and fresh bread. For dinner, gotta go with a pasta dish. I've had their tortellini stuffed with lobster and it was incredible. I've also had their gnocchi and it was the best ice ever had. You can't go wrong with any of the desserts, if you have any room left!
Ravioli were great a little undercooked
The meatballs are to die for!
Good food. Good service

Maybe I just had too high of expectations going into the establishment but I wasn't really impressed with Alavita. Food was really good, not great. Service was borderline lousy. Not sure if they are/were down a server and/or other waitstaff on the Wednesday night I was there, but everything took forever to get to the table. Even the water! Probably won't go back next time I'm in Boise.

Nice place downtown. The atmosphere is nice, intimate. The homemade pasta is so good. The parppardelle and sausage was well balanced and the pasta cooked perfectly. The chicken saltimbocca was delightful (chicken cooked just right, found the sage a bit overpowering, so pulled it out).
Never been disappointed here. The angel hair and parpadelle are to die for!
Excellent food. Terrible service unfortunately.
Gotta have this. Great place, try the tbone you won't be disappointed. I had to go back again a day later with friends and did it again.
This place doesn’t know how to disappoint. Amazing food and great service. Highly recommend
Pretty place, nice area and downtown patio. Their drinks are good and the food is decent. Overpriced for Boise
Love this place !  Great time!
My favorite restaurant in Boise
The seafood ravioli was considerably better than I would have expected. There could have been slightly more sauce on it but overall it was a fantastic meal.

Nice atmosphere, staff was very kind, but the food poisoning wasn’t very pleasant. Maybe it was just a fluke thing but don’t get the salmon there unless you want to wind up in the bathroom the whole next day.
Great atmosphere and super nice people.  Had a great dish and will definitely visit again.

I take my nieces and nephews on date nights.  A great way to get to know them and spend time with them!!  The younger ones always want dinner and a movie!!  Well my 17 year old niece works at the movie theater so I knew she wouldn’t want a movie so I told her to pick a place that we could have dinner she chose this cute little Italian restaurant!!  Our experience from start to finish was amazing!!  I can’t eat much so I had the Pork Belly appetizer and it was AMAZING!!  My niece loves pasta so she had the linguini with meatballs and she let me try her meatballs and the sauce and they were so flavorful and melt in your mouth goodness it was outstanding!!  To top off the night when we got our check it came in a little black book that you could write anything you wanted in it!!  That is a brilliant idea!!  Our Server was amazing the food was amazing will be going to visit again for sure!!!!

The restaurant is adorable. They play 1950’s music to add to the vintage atmosphere. Service was great. The manager personally checked on us and boxed up our food. Beer prices are good but not a lot to choose from. The wine selection is good but can be pricey. The food was delicious. Bruschetta appetizer was so yummy! A great place to have a fancy dinner downtown.

We stumbled across this by accident because of their great sidewalk tables. People watching and great food. Had their burrata appetizer, wonderful.  I had the salmon which was perfectly cooked and my daughter had the black ravioli. We're only in town for 4 days and may go back.  Lovely Oregon rose and the coconut chocolate gelato was amazing.
Love it!

Fantastic date night spot. Anytime my wife and I fly into Boise we always make a reservation here! Love being able to watch them make the pasta and it’s very romantic! Fellas take your wife, girlfriend, lover, boyfriend whoever there! Will not disappoint!
Sidewalk service or interior seating with craft cocktails and house made pasta.
I could live here. Pasta is great. Service is amazing. Drinks OMG. It is a nice place, but the prices aren’t outrageous. Favorite date night spot.
Always excellent...reservations are highly recommended due to the popularity of this place.
Nice little Italian place in the heart of downtown Boise. They make all pasta in house which you can watch thanks to the open kitchen. Reservations are recommended as it is a small place.
Good Italian restaurant with a good scene and excellent bar.

This place blew my mind with how friendly and knowledgeable the staff here is as well as the owner. Came here for my 2 year anniversary dinner and I couldn't have been more pleased with absolutelty everything. Thank you guys so much for the outstanding evening.
Great service, great food. One of my best meals in Boise.

This place is amazing. My favorite Italian place in Boise, great atmosphere and great for a date night. Really high quality food with homemade pasta and exceptional service. Great place, always a solid choice.
The food is so good and the artisan drinks good as well
Great place to enjoy a night out with family and friends. Will go again and again.

I regret ever going there!!  The staff were the MOST rude, inconsiderate people that I have ever encountered!!  SUCH BAD ATTITUDE!!  The staff made me sit at the bar even though the place was empty..    The staff never checked on me, asked me if the food was good, NOTHING!!!!!!   The only reason why there is 1 star is because the food was decent - yes, decent food if you don't mind waiting all night for it.  I am reporting my experience to my brother who works for Statesman and to channel 4 news.   ALAVITA - GET YOUR ACT TOGETHER!!!!!!
Excellent homemade pasta

Very nice restaurant, love their cheese pretzel sticks! Ambiance is lovely, they take reservations too (highly recommend making them) but unfortunately are not open for lunch. The bar area is nice too if you're just dropping in. Perfect for a nice date night.
Fabulous, Always, cannot go wrong, enjoy!!
Great food and atmosphere! Waitress was friendly and attentive

Good fresh pasta - none of the dishes offered sounded particularly amazing to me, but I can't say that what I ordered wasn't good - it was, just not my taste. I think they could expand their menu a bit.
Best pasta in Boise hands down
Great beet salad

Wonderful food. Excellent environment. Right next to the parking lot hence no problem parking as well. Rack of lamb is one of the finest I ever had also the signature black ravioli is just from a different world. Scallops we're good but a bit overdone however the artichini was the finest. Great atmosphere and wonderful service. Highly recommend reservation as it was all full till closing on a rainy Saturday.
Great food and fantastic service! A+
Appetizers seemed better than the entrees. We'll have to try again to see if we missed something.
Amazing food and atmosphere. We keep coming back form more.
Super good! My only complaint is the portion sizes. I just wish I got a little more bang for my buck is all 😂. Other than that, good food for sure!!
Great food if you like gourmet, ie. small, portions and pricier menu. Good atmosphere. Staff are super. It's for the special date , not for the big-plate spaghetti and meatballs kind of eater.
The food and the service was simply outstanding!
Great food!! Romantic atmosphere. Limited space.

I had an early Valentines Day date here and we had a 5/5 star experience.  I work in the industry and there was nothing that wasn't stellar.  Our server was incredible, the atmosphere was relaxing and intimate, and our food was amazing (the steak was fabulous).   We definitely look foreward to dining here again.
Great atmosphere and food
Great wines, fine Italian cuisine, superbly WONDERFUL!!!!
The food is fantastic. The atmosphere is great. The cocktails are amazing and the service is top notch. A great dining experience every time.
My tasting palate had a expansive and rewarding time all the way from first bite til last!
Absolutely delicious.  From the scallops to the grilled Caesar and then the lamb chops. Finished it all off with an affogato. Definitely will return for another date night.

I came here on a date with my husband.  The wine was delicious, the food was great, they make their own pasta every day, and dessert was yummy.  We had a good time and enjoyed Alavita.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because I thought it was a bit pricey for the portions.

This is hands down my favorite resturant in Boise. Their pasta is hand made, and the service is personal. If you go more then once, they will remember you. It is a pleasant feeling sitting down to dinner when you feel like they know you.
Great food and drink
This is one of the hardest places in Boise to get a reservation and there's a good reason for that. Amazing pastas and service. Great ambiance. Take your date here.

This is a great restaurant! Fun ambiance with a good variety on the menu. Take your time here, great service with a splendid array of Italian delights. Nice wine selections. Great place to make memories with friends.
I had the lamb. Really really good. And great service.  we'll be back

Make a reservation as it is a popular place, and with good reason. The menu is simple. A good thing too because I was torn over at least 3 dishes. The black ravioli was superb. Expert balance of flavors and textures. The shrimp angel hair dish was quite good also. Careful with the bar tab. 2 doubles of Jameson ran almost $40. Will definitely return if the opportunity presents itself.
Boise's finest Italian for quite some time.  Top notch servers complete the experience!

Excellent food (Except the bitter, grilled  romain salad), but way over priced. The manager did take the salad off, but had a very snoody attitude. They had the "I hate my job" attitude. We will not be going back.
Really excellent Italian place. Seasonal, locally sourced menu with excellent options.
